title: Restoring Common Sense to Federal Office Space Management

enrichment.summary: This executive order revokes two prior orders that required federal agencies to locate offices primarily in costly central business districts and historic properties, allowing agencies more flexibility to choose cost-effective office space where the people they serve actually are. It aims to make federal office space management more practical and efficient by permitting agencies to prioritize lower costs over strict location mandates.
potential_concerns: Agencies moving out of central business districts could harm local economies and reduce urban revitalization efforts.
Removing mandates to preserve historic building use may lead to neglect or loss of important cultural heritage sites.
Cost-cutting could result in agencies leasing less accessible locations, reducing public convenience and service quality.
The regulatory changes may lead to inconsistent standards across federal office leasing and management.
Stakeholders invested in prior policies may resist changes, creating implementation delays and conflicts.
